q: , 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. Quotes delayed, except where indicated otherwise. Delay times are 15 mins

The DOE funding will help Veeco to speed up its efforts to commercialize multi-stage thermal deposition production systems used to manufacture cost-efficient CIGS Solar cells. Commenting on the Veeco award, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-NY) said, Developing new, clean, homegrown sources of energy is a vital part of our economic recovery. This federal investment will help drive research and development of new solar power technology, helping make solar power more efficient.
